institutional.translation[0].definitions: institutional attitudes and behaviour have existed for a long time in an organization and have become accepted as normal even though they are bad
accusations of institutional racism in the police force
institutional.translation[1].definitions: economic and monetary union and related institutional reform of the EU
relating to activities of financial institutions, rather than other organizations or members of the public
Most of the investment was from institutional money.
Dealers reported a fair degree of institutional buying of the shares.
